faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Induktr templates and services

what_is_induktr.a: Induktr Portfolio is a boutique digital ecosystem created by @Induktr. It serves as both a showcase of high-end engineering and a marketplace for premium, production-ready templates and AI-powered tools.

how_it_works.q: How does the ordering process work?
how_it_works.a: Once you select a template in the Marketplace and click "Buy", you will receive payment instructions. After payment, you get an access code. Enter this code in our official Telegram Bot to instantly download the source files and documentation.

custom_projects.q: Can I hire you for a custom project?
custom_projects.a: Yes! I specialize in building MVPs, high-performance landings, and AI automations. Fill out the form on the "Start Project" page, and I will get back to you with a proposal.

stack.a: I primarily use Next.js, React, and TypeScript for the frontend, combined with Python (Flask/FastAPI) or Node.js for heavy logic and AI integrations. For styling, Tailwind CSS and Framer Motion are my standards.

ai_safety.q: Are the AI trading tools safe?
ai_safety.a: The A.S.T.R.A. and Hunter Bot tools are designed with "Safety First" principles. They include risk management modules and use official APIs. However, they are provided as frameworks for your own strategies; always test in testnets/sandbox.

payment_methods.a: I currently accept USDT (TRC20/ERC20/TON) and direct Bank Card transfers (USD/EUR). Details are provided during the checkout process.

refunds.a: Due to the digital nature of the products (source code access), I generally do not offer refunds once the files are downloaded. However, I provide full support to ensure the template works as advertised.

cta.title: Still have questions?
cta.desc: If you couldn't find the answer you were looking for, feel free to reach out to me directly on Telegram.

items.a: Induktr Portfolio is a boutique digital ecosystem created by @Induktr. It serves as both a showcase of high-end engineering and a marketplace for premium, production-ready templates and AI-powered tools.

items.q: How does the ordering process work?
items.a: Once you select a template in the Marketplace and click "Buy", you will receive payment instructions. After payment, you get an access code. Enter this code in our official Telegram Bot to instantly download the source files and documentation.

items.q: Can I hire you for a custom project?
items.a: Yes! I specialize in building MVPs, high-performance landings, and AI automations. Fill out the form on the "Start Project" page, and I will get back to you with a proposal.

I primarily use Next.js, React, and TypeScript for the frontend, combined with Python (Flask/FastAPI) or Node.js for heavy logic and AI integrations. For styling, Tailwind CSS and Framer Motion are my standards.

items.q: Are the AI trading tools safe?
items.a: The A.S.T.R.A. and Hunter Bot tools are designed with "Safety First" principles. They include risk management modules and use official APIs. However, they are provided as frameworks for your own strategies; always test in testnets/sandbox.
I currently accept USDT (TRC20/ERC20/TON) and direct Bank Card transfers (USD/EUR). Details are provided during the checkout process.

Due to the digital nature of the products (source code access), I generally do not offer refunds once the files are downloaded. However, I provide full support to ensure the template works as advertised.

tools.title: Tools and Technologies
tools.description: My personal toolkit and technologies that I have mastered, used to create innovative software solutions

about.title: About Me
about.subtitle: Junior Frontend Developer (React)
about.summary: Junior Frontend Developer focused on Result-Driven development. Specialized in creating modern, fast, and responsive web interfaces (SPA) using the React and Vue ecosystem. My strength is an engineering approach. I don't just write code; I care about component architecture, reusability (DRY), and user experience (UX).

items.description: Practical experience (Pet-projects & Freelance): Developed and deployed the corporate website for the construction company Westbud. Implemented a custom design system, interactive sliders, and modal windows without heavy libraries. Mobile-First responsiveness.
items.catalog: Interactive Product Catalog (JS + DOM API): Created an SPA product catalog application. Implemented complex filtering and search on the client side. Used the Constraint Validation API for forms.

achievements.title: Achievements
list: Commercial Success: Independently developed and deployed the corporate website for a construction company (Westbud) using the React + Tailwind stack ahead of the deadline.
Engineering Mindset: Implemented complex product filtering logic and custom form validation without using heavy libraries for maximum performance.
Discipline: Built a personal productivity system that allows consistently investing 50-60 hours per week in coding and learning.

expectations.title: Work Expectations
expectations.text: Looking for a team with a strong engineering culture where Code Review and mentoring are present. I'm not looking for an "easy job"; I'm looking for the opportunity to solve complex problems and grow quickly. My goal: to reach Strong Junior / Middle level within 1 year of active work. Open to Remote, Part-time, or project-based work.

postsData.title: Building a Modern Portfolio
postsData.excerpt: How I built this portfolio using React and modern web technologies
postsData.content:
# Building a Modern Portfolio

In this post, I'll share my experience building a modern portfolio website using React, Tailwind CSS, and other cutting-edge technologies.

## The Tech Stack

- React for the UI
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Framer Motion for animations

## Key Features

1. Dark/Light theme
2. Responsive design
3. Markdown support

postsData.title: Web Development Best Practices
postsData.excerpt: Essential practices for modern web development
postsData.content:
# Web Development Best Practices

Let's explore some essential practices for modern web development that I've learned over the years.

## 1. Performance First

Always optimize for performance from the start.

## 2. Responsive Design

Make your sites work on all devices.

## 3. Accessibility

Ensure your sites are accessible to everyone.
